+ /**

+ const showAnimatedBanner = (): Promise&lt;void&gt; =&gt; {
+   return new Promise((resolve) =&gt; {
+     const colors = [
+       chalk.red,
+       chalk.yellow,

+       chalk.cyan,
+       chalk.blue,
+       chalk.magenta,
+     ];

+       &quot;  â•šâ•â•  â•šâ•â• â•šâ•â•â•â•â•â• â•šâ•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•šâ•â•  â•šâ•â•â•â•   â•šâ•â•   â•šâ•â•â•â•â•â•â•&quot;,
+     ];
+ 
+     let colorOffset = 0;
+     let frameCount = 0;
+     const maxFrames = 12;
+ 
+     const interval = setInterval(() =&gt; {
+       console.clear();
+       console.log(); // Empty line at top
+ 
+       // Print SUPER
+       superArt.forEach((line) =&gt; {
+         let coloredLine = &quot;&quot;;
+         for (let i = 0; i &lt; line.length; i++) {
+           const colorIndex = (colorOffset + Math.floor(i / 8)) % colors.length;
+           coloredLine += colors[colorIndex](line[i]);
+         }
+         console.log(coloredLine);
+       });
+ 
+       console.log(); // Empty line between
+ 
+       // Print AGENTS
+       agentsArt.forEach((line) =&gt; {
+         let coloredLine = &quot;&quot;;
+         for (let i = 0; i &lt; line.length; i++) {
+           const colorIndex =
+             (colorOffset + Math.floor(i / 8) + 3) % colors.length;
+           coloredLine += colors[colorIndex](line[i]);
+         }
+         console.log(coloredLine);
+       });
+ 
+       console.log(); // Empty line at bottom
+ 
+       colorOffset = (colorOffset + 1) % colors.length;
+       frameCount++;
+ 
+       if (frameCount &gt;= maxFrames) {
+         clearInterval(interval);
+         resolve();
+       }
+     }, 150);
+   });
+ };

4. The colors move across the text creating a wave effect
5. The animation runs for 12 frames (about 1.8 seconds) before continuing with the rest of the setup

The animation uses setInterval to update the display every 150ms, cycling through rainbow colors with a gradient effect by coloring different sections of each line with different colors based on position, and shifting the colors on each frame.

_**User (2025-11-07 14:41Z)**_

ok but no make the rainbow colors horizontal, going down



and look at this, so ugly, this is no rainbow colors



I think you can't trust my terminal with chalk, you will need to be more strict on how you define colors

---

_**Agent (model claude-4.5-sonnet-thinking, mode Agent)**_

<think><details><summary>Thought Process</summary>
The user is showing me a screenshot where the rainbow colors are not working properly - instead of smooth rainbow transitions, there are harsh blocks of color that don't blend well. The issue is that my current implementation assigns colors based on horizontal position (characters across), but the user wants:

1. Colors to go horizontally (which means each line should be a different color)
2. The colors need to be more strictly defined because the terminal/chalk isn't rendering them smoothly

Looking at the screenshot, I can see the colors are being applied in a blocky way with harsh transitions. The user wants the rainbow to flow DOWN the text (line by line) rather than across it.

I need to:
